revised_title: Rewards and Recognition in Victorian Science: The Royal Medals of the Royal Society
tldr: This article explores the Royal Medals of the Royal Society, a reward system established during the Victorian era to encourage original scientific research. It discusses the origins and early years of the medals, their impact on the scientific community, and the political and institutional context in which they operated. The author highlights the importance of the Royal Medals in reinforcing recognition and establishing intellectual norms within the scientific community.
